info.name: Fine-Tuner
info.description: Forget lengthy development cycles and expensive machine learning teams. With Fine-Tuner you can build sophisticated, tailored AI agents without technical skills or coding - just bring your data and ideas. The Fine-Tuner REST API provides API endpoints for Fine-Tuner data types that allow to interact with your AI models remotely by sending and receiving JSON. ## Authentication Authentication to the Fine-Tuner API is performed via HTTP Bearer Authentication. Provide your **API Key** in the `Authorization` request header with the `Bearer` authentication scheme. ``` curl -H "Authorization: Bearer API_KEY" https://fine-tuner.ai/api/1.1/wf/... ``` ## Generate API Key To generate the API Key: - Log into the [Fine-Tuner Dashboard](). - Navigate to Settings → API KEY → GENERATE KEY to generate key. ## Model ID Each model carries its own distinct Model ID. To effectively use this, include the Model ID within the body of your request. After you've selected a deployed model, such as "Sales Agent", you'll notice the Model ID located in the top-right corner of your screen. This ID should be included as the **'model'** parameter in the JSON body of your request for seamless operation.

item.name: ConverSense Agent

request.description: This endpoint creates a new agent and retrieves it's model id.

This endpoint facilitates the interaction with a Sales Agent to generate responses or perform an inference. It requires the models unique identifier and a prompt message.

| Parameter | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| model | string | The identifier of the fine-tuned model. | yes |
| query | string | The question to pass to the model. | yes |
| user_id | string | A unique string identifier that you can pass to distinguish your individual users and their sessions. | yes |

response.name: Inference

item.description:
Our most versatile Agent that engages in conversation like a human and adapts its responses based on the specific context of a conversation. It can be used in many areas, like Sales, Customer support, Education, Healthcare, Recruiting and more.

Includes tools such as:

**Stage Recognition:** The Agent has a 'Stage Recognition' capability. When activated, it can recognize which stage is the Agent at and adjust it's behaviour accordingly.

**Entity Extraction:** Extraction keys enable the agent to identify, extract, and store relevant information during its interactions.

**Product Recommendations:** When this feature is activated, it enables the agent to suggest product recommendations seamlessly within the conversation, drawing from the uploaded product data as needed.

**Text to Speech:** When this feature is activated, it allows the AI Agent to transmute text responses into audible speech.

item.name: Vectors

request.description:
This endpoint allows users to vectorize text data and stores those in the vector database. | Parameter | Type | Description | Required | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | model | string | The identifier of the fine-tuned model. | yes | | doc_type | string | Choose one of the following types: "url" for a web address, "file" for a local file, or "text" for plain text content.

For files the following formats are possible: pdf, csv, pptx, docx, txt. | yes | | doc_string | string | Provide a website link (URL), a direct file link (URL), or a plain text input. | yes |

Queries vectors from the database based on similarity search. This endpoint allows users to find the most similar vectors to a given input text. EndFragment | Parameter | Type | Description | Required | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | model | string | The identifier of the fine-tuned model. | yes | | prompt | string | The input text based on which similarity search will be done.
| yes | | top_K | integer | The number of results to return for each query (defaults to 3).
| no |

request.description:
This endpoint allows users to delete uploaded vectors from the vector database.

| Parameter | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| source_id | string | The identifier of the uploaded source data (provided by the "Upload vectors" API call). | yes |

item.description: Enables you to generate and store embeddings (vector representations) of your data in a vector database. These embeddings can be used for various purposes, such as contextual memory for your agents and chatbots, similarity search, clustering, or as input for other machine learning models.

item.name: Widget

query.description: Please replace with appropriate Model ID

request.description:
Retrieves the widget embedding code of a chatbot.

| Parameter | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| model | querystring | The identifier of the fine-tuned model. | yes |

response.name: Widget Code

request.description:
Updates the widget's style parameters.

| Parameter | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| model | string | The identifier of the fine-tuned model. | yes |
| background_color | string | Background color of the widget as hex (i.e. #000000). | no |
| message_bubble_bg_color | string | Background color of widget's message bubble as hex (i.e. #000000). | no |
| message_bubble_font_color | string | Font color of widget's message bubble as hex (i.e. #000000). | no |

item.description:
These endpoints enable you to interact with pre-constructed widgets for your models which can be seamlessly embedded on your website. Includes retrieving the code of the widget and personalizing the widget's appearance.

NOTE: currently supporting only ConverSense Agent and Doc QA.

item.name: LLM Fine-Tuning

request.description:
Generates a completion using the fine-tuned model based on the input prompt. This endpoint allows users to test the model's performance and generate outputs tailored to their specific needs.

| Parameter | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| model | string | The identifier of the fine-tuned model. | yes |
| prompt | string | The input text for the model to complete. | yes |
| temperature | integer | Controls the randomness of the output. Higher values result in more diverse completions, while lower values make the output more deterministic. | no |
| max_tokens | integer | Maximum number of tokens in the generated response. | no |

response.name: Fine-Tuned completion
response.body:
{
    "status": "success",
    "response": {
        "completion": " FEATURES:

Responsive design to ensure compatibility across all devices
Landing page to showcase the platform
Payments & refunds powered by Stripe to allow customers to pay for services
User dashboards for customers and instructors to manage their profiles, bookings, and cancellations
Cancellation policies to ensure a fair and transparent booking process
Messaging system to enable communication between customers and instructors
On-site and email notifications to keep customers and instructors informed of important events
Admin dashboard to manage user accounts, categories, and transactions, and testimonials

USER TYPES DESCRIPTION:

Customer

Can create a profile to book services
Can share their profile via social media
Can add lessons to their favorites list
Can book and cancel a lesson based on the cancellation policy
Can leave a review for the instructor after the lesson is completed
Receives on-site notifications for certain events
Can send messages to the instructor
Can become an instructor

Instructor

Can create and manage listings for lessons
Can choose a cancellation policy for each listing separately
Receives on-site notifications for certain events
Can send messages to the customer
Can cancel a listing
Approves the booking before the customer"
    }
}

request.description:
Fetches the training data associated with the current fine-tuned model. This allows users to review and analyze the dataset used for fine-tuning.

| Parameter | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| model | string | The identifier of the fine-tuned model. | yes |

item.description: This method involves adjusting a pre-trained LLM to better suit a specific task or dataset. The process leverages the knowledge already embedded in the model while adapting it to the specific requirements of the new task. This is more complex approach and requires larger dataset.

item.name: Chatbot

body.raw:
{
    "model": "{{Model ID}}", //Please replace with appropriate Model_ID.
    "query": "what is EigenLayer",
    "chain_type": "map_reduce",
    "temperature": 0,
    "user_id": "",
    "llm": "gpt-3.5-turbo"
}

request.description:
Enables you to set up a chatbot to chat over the uploaded documents (PDF, CSV, PowerPoint, Word documents, Text or URL). | Parameter | Type | Description | Required | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | model | string | The identifier of the fine-tuned model. | yes | | query | string | The question to pass to the model. | yes | | chain_type | string | "stuff", "map_reduce", or "refine" | no | | temperature | string | Controls the randomness of the output. Higher values result in more diverse completions, while lower values make the output more deterministic (defaults to 0). | no | | llm | string | Currently available:
anthropic
davinci-003
gpt-3.5-turbo
gpt-4

(defaults to "davinci-003"). | no | | user_id | string | A unique string identifier that you can pass to distinguish your individual users.
| no |

response.name: Inference

request.description: This endpoint creates a new chatbot and retrieves it's model id.

This endpoint allows users to delete the chatbot by passing it's model id.

| Parameter | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| model | string | The identifier of the fine-tuned model. | yes |

item.description: Question answering in this context refers to question answering over your document data. Combining language models with your own text data is a powerful way to differentiate them.

item.name: CSV Agent

request.description:
Interact with data in csv format and generate visualizations.

| Parameter | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| model | string | The identifier of the fine-tuned model. | yes |
| query | string | The question to pass to the model. | yes |
| url | string | The URL of the CSV file. | yes |

response.name: Interact

item.description: This agent can interact with data in csv format and generate visualizations. It is mostly optimized for question answering.
